column7: Goodman's scope 2 emissions in 2023 were 4,665 tCO2e.
Goodman's scope 3 emissions in 2023 were 15,815 tCO2e.

column13: Goodman researched pathways to reduce embodied carbon in new developments. This research identified opportunities for carbon-neutral developments and opportunities relating to low-carbon concrete and steel. In terms of resilience, Goodman's Australian operations have completed a structural integrity review of its assets to assess potential structural issues for older assets during extreme weather events, such as storms and hailstorms.
column20: Carbon-neutral development, low-carbon concrete, extreme weather event

column13: Goodman Westlink's LEED Gold pre-certification set a new benchmark for sustainable industrial development in Hong Kong SAR Ã¢ÂÂ with more LEED certifications in the pipeline. The Hong Kong SAR team considered resilience, energy and water efficiency, solar PV, circularity, biodiversity, and health and well-being features in the four-storey Westlink building, which spans nearly 140,000 sqm of gross lettable area.
column20: LEED Gold, sustainable industrial development, Westlink building

column13: Thanks to a partnership with renewable energy provider BayWa r.e and its customer, METRO LOGISTICS, Goodman's Marl Logistics Centre in Germany is setting records Ã¢ÂÂ the largest rooftop solar PV system across Goodman properties globally and the largest operational rooftop system in Germany. The system consists of two installations with a total 18 MWp capacity across the site.

In properties with less opportunity for rooftop solar, Goodman seeks renewable electricity from accredited suppliers or using international renewable energy certificates (I-RECs), including those produced from Goodman's large-scale solar PV installations. For example, Goodman in Mainland China has commenced generating I-RECs from its solar PV installations, which, once issued and retired under the I-REC standard, can offset Goodman's electricity consumption across Mainland China and Hong Kong SAR and reduce their respective Scope 2 emissions.
column20: International renewable energy certificate, solar PV, electricity consumption

column6: Nitrogen oxides (NOx), sulfur oxides (SOx), and other significant air emissions
Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts

column13: Goodman's France team's deconstruction took nine months and a lot of patience and persistence. To increase the reuse of materials recovered, Goodman used an online waste marketplace to match supply from the site. For example, a local farmer received a motor pump while the transformer was decommissioned for future reuse. Two generators, 17 sanitary equipment, and 1,289 lights were also recovered for reuse.
column20: Deconstruction, materials recovered, online waste marketplace

column6: Non-compliance with environmental laws and regulations
New suppliers that were screened using environmental criteria
Negative environmental impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: Employee surveys are a way Goodman understands employee attitudes and specific viewpoints. In FY23, surveys were completed in the UK, Greater China and New Zealand, indicating high employee engagement satisfaction. Within these surveys, 91 per cent of responders in Greater China reported that their employment experience exceeded their expectations, and 90 per cent of responders in New Zealand favourably reported an inclusive culture.
column20: Employee survey, employee engagement, employment experience

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: Goodman's newest offices aim to provide modern and sustainable surroundings, blending quiet spaces and areas where people can connect and collaborate. Where possible, Goodman's workplaces prioritise natural light and fresh air and include break-out spaces and access to garden areas. Many of Goodman's offices have yoga rooms, end-of-trip facilities, gyms and multi-faith rooms, with fit-outs that incorporate non-toxic materials and integrated plants and trees, which can help lower stress and enhance mental clarity.

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: Goodman maintains a hybrid working model, supporting employees while meeting customer and investor needs. Goodman's approach combines remote and in-office work successfully managed through effective collaboration tools, IT systems, and policies.
column20: Hybrid working, in-office work, IT system

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: Goodman's Japan business completed a wellness zone in FY23 featuring two running tracks nearly four kilometres long and an outdoor gym catering to all fitness levels. The wellness zone builds on the existing health and well-being facilities at Goodman Business Park, which include a rest space for long-haul truck drivers that looks and feels more like a high-end airport lounge. It includes showers, Japanese 'tatami' sleep mats, a convenience store, a laundry, a kitchenette, and tables to eat and relax.
column20: Wellness zone, running track, well-being facility

column13: In Australia, Goodman's parental leave benefits extend beyond the 16 weeks of paid parental leave. Goodman maintains superannuation contributions to parents in Australia throughout their entire leave period, not just while they are being paid. In addition, Goodman's parental leave policy for Australian-based employees was extended to include time on parental leave in long-service entitlement calculations. The US team also updated its parental leave policy to provide a 40 per cent salary subsidy to reduce the parental leave pay gap.
column20: Parental leave, superannuation, parental leave pay gap

column13: The Circle In and Enboarder online tools are used in New Zealand and Australia to help support Goodman's working parents and people taking parental leave. Goodman's New Zealand team also offered independent coaching through a Works for Everyone partnership to support parents returning from leave transition back to work.

column6: Minimum notice periods regarding operational changes
Occupation health and safety management system
column13: Goodman is committed to the prevention of harm in its operations. Goodman's Global Safety Framework sets a minimum standard of safety that it requires across its global operations in line with Goodman's risk appetite statement.

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: During the year, the Goodman UK team participated in mental health awareness training with the specialist organisation Work Well-Being. Later, an additional full-day training was arranged, recognising managers' special role in positive day-to-day practices. Managers were taught how to spot warning signs, have productive conversations, manage challenges and support people returning to work.
column20: Mental health awareness training, Work Well-Being, warning sign
